folder: Cropsey Avenue & Bay 17th Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
Cropsey Ave., south side, between Bay 17th and Bay 19th Streets, showing the summer home of the New York Children's Aid Society, which was founded in 1881 by Andros H. Stone.

March 1925.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

The same, showing a rear view of other buildings, belonging to the Society.

October 1928.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

The same, showing another rear view, from Bay 19th Street.

October 1928.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

folder: Cropsey Avenue & Bay 17th Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
1755-1763 Cropsey Ave., north side, at the N.E. corner of Bay 17th Street. The house on the extreme right, is 1763 Cropsey Ave.
January 11, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

ASSUMING STREET TO BE EAST AND WEST

folder: Cropsey Avenue & Bay 17th Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
(1) Cropsey Ave., south side, between Bay 17th and 19th Streets. A view of a number of homes and cottages, for children under the jurisdiction of the N.Y. Children's Aid Society. It is the Children's Summer Home.

April 27, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, another angle.

April 27, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) The same, another angle.

April 27, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

ASSUMING STREET TO BE EAST AND WEST

folder: Cropsey Avenue & Bay 17th Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
Cropsey Ave., south side, between Bay 17 and Bay 19 Streets. A view of the gate house to the summer home of the N.Y. Children's Aid Society.

April 27, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

ASSUMING STREET TO BE EAST AND WEST.

folder: Cropsey Avenue & Bay 17th and 18th Streets., Brooklyn, NY
original_title: Brooklyn: Cropsey Avenue - Bay 17th and 18th Streets.
text:
Cropsey Avenue, west side, between Bay 17th and Bay 18th Streets, showing the Summer Home of the New York Children's Aid Society, overlooking Gravesend Bay.

October 27, 1936

Federal Art Project--W. P. A.
Photo by Berenice Abbott
